Hello, I'm curious how many installations have enabled ORCID authentication? We at UNC would like to pursue that, but they want to set up a meeting to determine:

â€¢ Confirm use of OAuth to collect authenticated ORCID iDs. Specify scopes used.
â€¢ Do not allow users to edit, search for, type in ORCID iDs.
â€¢ Confirm that ORCID iDs are being publicly displayed. Check display formats.
â€¢ Confirm that at least ORCID iD and access token are being stored (on the backend).

Is this for the GDCC ORCID grant?

Jim announced this: https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/zgj35spCkok/m/n_wk5pwfCQAJ?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer

(not sure why that email is in a thread with a different subject line - it's the 3rd email).

Thank you all! With the help of Jim Myers' work on the GDCC grant and the observation that three installations were already approved, UNC Dataverse should soon be the 4th installation known to allow ORCID authentication.
Don Sizemore has marked this topic as resolved.
Hi I see you closed the topic so probably too late but Recherche Data Gouv also allows ORCID auth
